snippet: Lunch should be free for all New York City public schoolchildren to eliminate the stigma that comes from being identified as poor.
abstract: Editorial calls for public school lunches to be made free for all New York City students in effort to reduce stigma attached to taking free lunch for those children who truly need it; notes that 250,000 of 780,000 children who are poor enough to qualify for free lunch do not participate in program; holds that cost of adopting universal free lunch would be low and payoffs significant; urges Mayor Bill de Blasio and schools chancellor Carmen Farina to embrace idea.
lead_paragraph: Lunch should be free for all New York City public schoolchildren to eliminate the stigma that comes from being identified as poor.
